I study the behavior and communication of politicians and parties using cutting-edge data and computational methods. In my dissertation, I develop measures of politicians' use of issue emphasis and nonverbal behavior based on a large collection of audio recordings of parliamentary speeches in the Danish Parliament from 2000-2022.

Substantially, I use these new methods and data sources to understand political representation, legislative politics, and party competition. For instance, in a recent working paper (coauthored with Frederik Hjorth) we show that legislators use nonverbal signals to communicate partisan and policy conflict.
